meeting_context:
# North Star & Strategic Context

This file combines the overall project mission (North Star) and summaries of key strategic documents for use in AI prompts, particularly for the AI Agent Council context generation.

---

**North Star:**
To build a truly autonomous, sustainable DAO that develops open-source software accelerating the path toward AGI, blending AI researchers, open-source hackers, and crypto degens to create AI agents streaming, shitposting, and trading 24/7 on auto.fun to attract users and bootstrap an autonomous organization.

---

**ElizaOS Mission Summary (`docs/blog/mission.mdx`):**
The elizaOS mission is to build an extensible, modular, open-source AI agent framework for Web2/Web3, seeing agents as steps toward AGI. Core values are Autonomy, Modularity, and Decentralization. Key products include the framework itself, DegenSpartanAI (trading agent), Autonomous Investor/Trust Marketplace (social trading intelligence), and the Agent Marketplace/auto.fun (launchpad).

---

**ElizaOS Reintroduction Summary (`docs/blog/reintroduction.mdx`):**
elizaOS is an open-source "operating system for AI agents" aimed at decentralizing AI development away from corporate control. It's built on three pillars: 1) The Eliza Framework (TypeScript toolkit for persistent, interoperable agents), 2) AI-Enhanced Governance (building autonomous DAOs), and 3) Eliza Labs (R&D for future capabilities like v2, Trust Marketplace, auto.fun, DegenSpartanAI, Eliza Studios). The native Solana token coordinates the ecosystem and captures value. The vision is an intelligent internet built on open protocols and collaboration.

---

**Auto.fun Introduction Summary (`docs/blog/autofun-intro.mdx`):**
Auto.fun is an AI-native, creator-first token launchpad designed for sustainable AI/crypto projects. It aims to balance fair community access with project funding needs through mechanisms like bonding curves and liquidity NFTs. Key features include a no-code agent builder, AI-generated marketing tools, and integration with the elizaOS ecosystem. It serves as a core product driving value back to the native token ($ai16z) through buybacks and liquidity pairing.

---

**Taming Information Summary (`docs/blog/taming_info.mdx`):**
Addresses the challenge of information scattered across platforms (Discord, GitHub, X). Proposes using AI agents as "bridges" to collect, wrangle (summarize/tag), and distribute information in various formats (JSON, MD, RSS, dashboards, 3D shows). Showcases an AI News system and AI Assistants for tech support as examples. Emphasizes treating documentation as a first-class citizen to empower AI assistants and streamline community operations.
monthly_goal: Current focus: Stabilize and attract new users to auto.fun by showcasing 24/7 agent activity (streaming, trading, shitposting), ship production ready elizaOS v2.
daily_focus: ElizaOS v2 development continues to progress with significant UI/UX improvements and new core features including action chaining and form plugins, while social media visibility issues and community concerns about value accrual persist.

key_points.summary: The project's X (Twitter) account remains suspended, affecting visibility and market momentum while formal recovery negotiations with X are ongoing.

deliberation_items.text: How should we address the community's growing concerns about project momentum during this extended period without our main social media channel?
context: Significant concern about the prolonged suspension of the project's X (Twitter) account (Discord 2025-07-12)
The project is in formal talks with Twitter/X to restore their lost account, with team members explaining they can't create secondary accounts as it would jeopardize negotiations (Discord 2025-07-11)

answer_1.text: Prioritize alternative communication channels (Discord, blog posts, YouTube) while maintaining cautious optimism about X account recovery.
answer_1.implication: Maintains status quo which may not address immediate community concerns but preserves negotiation position with X.

answer_2.text: Create a temporary "elizaOS Updates" X account specifically for critical announcements while continuing main account recovery efforts.
answer_2.implication: Risks negotiations with X but provides immediate visibility improvement and demonstrates proactivity to the community.

answer_3.text: Launch a concentrated community ambassador program, empowering trusted community members to amplify project updates through their personal channels.
answer_3.implication: Distributes communication responsibility and potentially builds stronger community bonds, though message consistency may suffer.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

deliberation_items.text: Should we accelerate the development of an auto.fun-native social media solution as a strategic response to platform dependency risks?
context: Community members expressed concern about losing market visibility without social media presence (Discord 2025-07-11)
Community members expressing concerns about value accrual for token holders (Discord 2025-07-12)

answer_1.text: Yes, immediately prioritize development of an auto.fun social layer to reduce dependency on centralized platforms.
answer_1.implication: Could create a unique selling proposition but diverts resources from core product development priorities.

answer_2.text: No, maintain focus on core elizaOS v2 development and auto.fun stability while pursuing X account recovery.
answer_2.implication: Preserves development focus on monthly goals but leaves the project vulnerable to similar platform risks in the future.

answer_3.text: Develop a minimal viable social broadcast feature within auto.fun that syndicates to multiple platforms simultaneously.
answer_3.implication: Balances development priorities while adding resilience against future platform dependency risks.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

key_points.summary: ElizaOS v2 development is proceeding with significant UI overhaul and new features like action chaining and forms, but Windows compatibility and Twitter integration issues are impacting developer experience.

deliberation_items.text: How should we prioritize Windows platform support given the current technical challenges?
context: Plugin-local-ai failing to load on Windows (Issue #5499)
Several users reported issues with the Twitter plugin, which was fixed in version 1.2.0 (Discord 2025-07-11)
Windows-specific errors related to ESM URL schemes were encountered when trying to run plugin-local-ai (Discord 2025-07-11)

answer_1.text: Elevate Windows support to a top priority to ensure broader adoption among developers.
answer_1.implication: Would improve developer accessibility but potentially delay other core feature development.

answer_2.text: Maintain Windows as a secondary target platform, focusing on critical fixes while prioritizing core feature development.
answer_2.implication: Balances resources but may limit adoption among Windows-centric developers and enterprises.

answer_3.text: Implement a specialized Windows task force with dedicated resources and community contributors focused solely on addressing platform-specific issues.
answer_3.implication: Creates focused attention on Windows without significantly diverting core team resources.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

deliberation_items.text: Given the Twitter API's high cost barrier ($200/month Pro tier requirement), how should we approach social media plugin development?
context: Free tier is not supported by the plugin, you need the Pro tier at $200/month (answered by cjft)
Why am I getting rate limited with Twitter even with TWITTER_SEARCH_ENABLE=false? (asked by JoeyWheelz)

answer_1.text: Continue developing for premium API tiers only, focusing on quality features for power users and businesses.
answer_1.implication: Limits user adoption but ensures reliable functionality for those who can afford premium API access.

answer_2.text: Pivot to developing plugins for more accessible platforms (e.g., Bluesky, Mastodon, Farcaster) with better developer economics.
answer_2.implication: Opens new, potentially more developer-friendly ecosystems but reduces integration with mainstream platforms.

answer_3.text: Develop a community pool model where multiple users can share access to a single premium API subscription through the plugin.
answer_3.implication: Creates novel value proposition but introduces significant technical and terms-of-service compliance challenges.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

key_points.summary: AUTO.FUN platform is showing growing traction with new tokens like ELI5 and EDDY, while technical issues with token creation and questions about the incubator function remain unresolved.

deliberation_items.text: How should we address the growing community interest in ELI5 as an "AUTO.FUN official coin" while maintaining focus on the core platform development?
context: What is Eddy? (asked by Quaser M) A: It's an Auto.fun coin, confirmed by Shaw and organization members (answered by CULTVESTING)
Q: What's eli5? (asked by k) A: Autodotfun official coin (answered by emptyskull)
Q: Wonder if this means eli5 is official now or not? (asked by traderlv) A: "Today we heard its gonna be an incubator, can't be more official than that" (Dr. Neuro)

answer_1.text: Formally recognize and integrate ELI5 as an official AUTO.FUN ecosystem token with specific utility functions.
answer_1.implication: Creates clear positioning but potentially dilutes focus from primary token economics.

answer_2.text: Maintain neutral platform stance by establishing clear criteria for "official" vs. community tokens rather than designating specific tokens.
answer_2.implication: Preserves platform neutrality but may lead to continued community confusion about token status.

answer_3.text: Develop a tiered verification system for AUTO.FUN tokens that can grant different levels of official recognition based on quantifiable metrics.
answer_3.implication: Creates transparent framework for token recognition but adds operational complexity to the platform.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

deliberation_items.text: What approach should we take to resolve the technical issues with token creation and trading on AUTO.FUN?
context: Users discussing specific tokens like "Eli5", "Eddy", and "JIMMY" on the AUTO.FUN platform (Discord 2025-07-12)
Technical issues reported with token creation and trading on AUTO.FUN (Discord 2025-07-12)
Update to AUTO.FUN's incubator feature mentioned (Discord 2025-07-12)

answer_1.text: Implement a comprehensive platform stability freeze, pausing new feature development until all token creation and trading issues are resolved.
answer_1.implication: Prioritizes platform reliability but delays feature roadmap execution.

answer_2.text: Create a dedicated AUTO.FUN technical support channel with specialized team members to rapidly address user-reported token issues.
answer_2.implication: Improves user experience and issue resolution speed without disrupting development workflow.

answer_3.text: Launch an automated token diagnostic tool that helps users identify and potentially self-resolve common token creation and trading issues.
answer_3.implication: Scales support capabilities but requires significant upfront development investment.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.
